title.narrative: F.a: Organizational Development of Employees' Unions

description.narrative: The project improves working conditions and collective bargaining of the employees in Colombia.Employees often possess key positions in their work places and in their respective unions, but the affiliation level within this group of workers is extremely lo w. Due to the structural changes in labor markets and economy, precarious labor and out-sourcing are increasing among the white collar workers and a new group of precarious workers, who don't have any labor security or means to defend their labor and trade union rights, is arising in the labor market. In Colombia, the anti-trade union attitudes are more common among employees than among workers and employers in the white-collar workplaces have strong anti-union policies: illegal dismissals, discrimination a nd out-sourcing of labor are common means of employers to show organized workers that trade unions are not accepted in their workplace. In general, employees' knowledge on their legal labor rights is poor and employees fear to join a union, mainly due to t he violence and persecution of trade union activists during many decades in Colombia. This project strengthens employees' unions in order to improve the defense of employees' labor rights and strengthen collective bargaining.As a result of this project, th e employees' unions in Cundinamarca, Antioquia and Santander regions will be stronger and able to defend effectively the principles of Decent Work. Union activists and leaders will be trained and union membership will increase.The beneficiaries of this pro ject are employees in Cundinamarca, Antioquia and Santander regions.The project is implemented by Confederacion de Trabajadores de Colombia (CTC) together with its member unions.
